title: Geo: Proxy Git push over SSH via Workhorse, not Rails
description:
## Problem

See https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8819

## Proposal

https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8819#note_1230815146:

> Make gitlab-shell call the appropriate route on the secondary Workhorse to let the "new" proxying behavior handle the proxying, instead of the `proxy_git_ssh` routes which are proxied by Rails.

#### Before

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant C as Git on client
    participant S as GitLab Shell
    participant I as Workhorse & Rails
    participant P as Workhorse & Rails

    Note left of C: git fetch
    Note over S,I: Secondary site
    Note over P: Primary site
    C->>+S: ssh git receive-pack request
    S->>I: SSH key validation (api/v4/internal/authorized_keys?key=..)
    I-->>S: HTTP/1.1 300 (custom action status) with {endpoint, msg, primary_repo}
    S->>I: POST /api/v4/geo/proxy_git_ssh/info_refs_receive_pack
    I->>P: POST $PRIMARY/foo/bar.git/info/refs/?service=git-receive-pack
    P-->>I: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    I-->>S: <response>
    S-->>C: return Git response from primary
    C-->>S: stream Git data to push
    S->>I: POST /api/v4/geo/proxy_git_ssh/receive_pack
    I->>P: POST $PRIMARY/foo/bar.git/git-receive-pack
    P-->>I: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    I-->>S: <response>
    S-->>-C: gitlab-shell receive-pack response
```

#### After

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant C as Git on client
    participant S as GitLab Shell
    participant I as Workhorse & Rails
    participant P as Workhorse & Rails

    Note left of C: git fetch
    Note over S,I: Secondary site
    Note over P: Primary site
    C->>+S: ssh git receive-pack request
    S->>I: SSH key validation (api/v4/internal/authorized_keys?key=..)
    I-->>S: HTTP/1.1 300 (custom action status) with {endpoint, msg, primary_repo}
    S->>I: POST /-/push_from_secondary/2/foo/bar.git/info/refs/?service=git-receive-pack
    I->>P: Proxy to primary
    P-->>I: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    I-->>S: <response>
    S-->>C: return Git response from primary
    C-->>S: stream Git data to push
    S->>I: POST /-/push_from_secondary/2/foo/bar.git/git-receive-pack
    I->>P: Proxy to primary
    P-->>I: HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    I-->>S: <response>
    S-->>-C: gitlab-shell receive-pack response
```

Note that this proposal is different from a previous initial attempt to proxy via Workhorse which was abandoned:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-workhorse/-/merge_requests/319
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-workhorse/-/merge_requests/320
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/8324

The difference is that today, we can take advantage of Workhorse proxying pieces already in place https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/geo/secondary_proxy/index.html which allow Workhorse to proxy the stream to the primary instead of [copying it](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-workhorse/-/merge_requests/320#note_124749927). Though this proposal doesn't resolve the fact that gitlab-shell already holds a copy.

title: Geo Sites - Invalid prop href, Expected String go URL
description:
## What / Why

We are getting Vue console errors in GDK (suppressed on Production).  This is due to us passing a URL object to `GlLink` rather than the String representation.

## Screenshot

![Screenshot_2023-01-09_at_12.18.25_PM](/uploads/78a168eb77cee6117e43e6ee70335715/Screenshot_2023-01-09_at_12.18.25_PM.png)

## Proposal

1. Convert the URL to its String in `geo_node_replication_details.vue` before sending it to the `GlLink` component

1. Create a new account (or use an account which doesn't have credit card added yet)

title: Geo Sites - Simplify Verification Status Logic
description:
## What / Why

Follow up from discovery in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/387069

It was recently discovered we have a `verification_enabled?` method on every Registry in Geo.  This Boolean will allow us to communicate to the FE whether or not Verification is enabled on a Registry.

Currently in the UI we have some complicated logic to determine whether or not Verification is enabled on a Registry based on the existence of certain data values.  Then logic could be completely removed from our code base by leveraging this Boolean value.

## Proposal

1. Expose `verificaiton_enabled?` to `replicable_types` in `ee/geo_helper.rb`
2. Refactor `verificationInfo` getter in [`ee/geo_nodes/getters.js`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/geo_nodes/store/getters.js#L4-36) to use the Boolean

title: Geo - Make search method reusable across registries
description:
## Summary

This is related to: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/364722

After allowing Geo to filter registries by keyword, we identified an opportunity to make the `search` method reusable across registries and make the code DRY. 

A proposal can be found here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/102710#note_1208195076.

Additionally, there is a good opportunity to move this method to a `finder` class instead: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/reusing_abstractions.html#finders

## Improvements

We want to extract that common pattern into something more reusable across registries and avoid code duplication.

## Risks

We want to make sure that filtering by keyword works as expected.

## Involved components

There is a common pattern between the registries introduced by the following MRs:

* Geo - Support filtering job artifact registries by keyword via GraphQL !107047
* Geo - Support filtering pipeline artifacts by keyword via GraphQL !107049
* Geo - Support filtering secure files by keyword via GraphQL !107051
* Geo - Support filtering package files by keyword via GraphQL !107052
* Geo - Support filtering terraform state versions by keyword via GraphQL !107053
* Geo - Support filtering container repositories by keyword via GraphQL !107101
* Geo - Support filtering LFS objects registries by keyword via GraphQL !107105
* Geo - Support filtering merge request diffs by keyword via GraphQL !107227
* Geo - Support filtering pages deployment by keyword via GraphQL !107230
* Geo - Support filtering snippet repositories by keyword via GraphQL !107231
* Geo - Support filtering uploads registries by keyword via GraphQL !107235
* Geo - Support filtering design registries by keyword via GraphQL !107256
* Geo - Support filtering group wiki repositories by keyword via GraphQL !107260

title: Geo: Possible bug in backfilling Container Repository
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/107421, `RepositoryRegistrySyncWorker` uses `container_repositories_max_capacity` because it is intended to schedule container repository sync jobs for backfilling, retrying failures, and to cover any rare lost events.

However based on reading the code, I think it is not handling container repositories, and is only handling Git repositories. This makes sense long-term. But to resolve the current bug, we could force it to handle container repositories as well for now.

title: Geo Replicable - Only request verification info if verification is enabled
description:
## What / Why Follow up to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/385753
Related thread: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/385753#note_1212972356 Currently in the Geo Replicable UI we request verification info via GraphQL from every Registry regardless if the Registry supports verification. Requesting this data throws an error and fails the request due to the verification data not existing on non-supported Registries. The workaround currently is to define empty verification methods on the Registries to get the GraphQL request to pass. Additionally the UI will then say `Last verified: Unknown`. Currently (2022-01-04) the following Registries that don't support verification and are using this workaround are: 1. [Container Repositories](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/geo/container_repository_registry.rb#L13-21) 2. [Group Wiki Repositories](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/geo/group_wiki_repository_registry.rb#L11-21) ## Proposal 1. Expose `verification_enabled?` to `ee/geo/replicables/index.html.haml` 3. Remove "dummy methods" from registries that have no verification 3. Add logic GraphQL request to not fetch verification keys if verification enabled is false 4. Add UI elements to express verification is disabled in the UI cc/ @vsizov @dbalexandre @juan-silva this is the follow up issue we discussed in the Geo Scheduling call on 2022-01-03

title: Geo Sites - Incorrect DataType for Container Repositories
description:
## What / Why Follow up to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/373303
Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/93690
Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/98466 Container Repositories are not being registered as a separate Data Type in the Geo UI. This is due to the Replicator overriding the `data_type_title` but not overriding the `data_type` value to the new Data Type. The UI **must** group the data types by their `data_type` as the `data_type_title` is internationalized. Code in reference to the issue: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/replicators/geo/container_repository_replicator.rb#L44-50 ## Screenshot ![Screen_Shot_2023-01-03_at_12.17.48_PM](/uploads/2c7583d886ef8dc8a52026a827677855/Screen_Shot_2023-01-03_at_12.17.48_PM.png) ## Proposal Properly update the Replicator for Container Repositories to the new `data_type` => `container_repository` ```rb def data_type 'container_repository' end ``` ## Risks I am unsure if there was a reason to not update the `data_type`. Worried about some potential generalization in the BE that may key off this value. From what I originally understood Container Repositories had a different replication strategy so we needed an entirely new data type. cc/ @mkozono @vsizov

title: API/DAST Fuzz scanner fails when response is too large: `Session failed: Input string was not in a correct format.`
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

API and DAST Fuzz scans fail with `Session failed: Input string was not in a correct format.` error seemingly due to size of response to API request.

When error occurs, log includes dump of response text where only `StatusCode` should be displayed, suggesting some kind of buffer overflow occurring. e.g.

```
20:49:50.130 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> Request 'GET https://example-app.com:443/users'
20:49:50.522 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> Response StatusCode: 200 Status: 200
20:49:50.533 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> Request 'GET https://example-app.com:443/users/string-without-format'
20:49:58.956 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> Response StatusCode: ﹏桖㜥澑銭縃◢ꕙ㚯옞
<plus MBs more>
ing-without-formatstring-without-formatstring-without-formatstring-without-formatstring-without-formatstring-without-formatstring-with","surname":"string-without-format"},{"id":15,"name":"string-without-format","surname":"4\u0019P\u001f\nQ!tc\u0016-^?#+u-}zN(`^?w#tG\u0014[]\u000e{o\u0018<\u0014z+d\u00018\f[uQ\u0016GmsxbywR#T\u0016v~fW,Ko.\u0015wNGP\u0016Y\u0006y\u0012arraIhol8Ei?-\t1S|w\u0017T_z@\u001dD8\u0014b\u0004:c\u0016z\u0015zu\u001b3_8\u000e+\n\u0012\u001d\u0018\u0018?\u0004=
20:51:59.030 [ERR] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> * Session failed: Input string was not in a correct format.
20:51:59.054 [INF] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> Finished testing. Performed a total of 127 requests.
20:52:06.419 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.JobService> Dispose
20:52:06.422 [DBG] <Peach.Web.Core.Services.WebRunnerMachine> DisposeAsync
```

```
2022-12-20 20:49:01 [INF] DAST API: Generating security report as 'gl-dast-api-report.json'.
2022-12-20 20:49:02 [ERR] DAST API: Error getting the security report json for session 'b7e14801-4c41-44c4-9e75-3ae35b2f1b74'
2022-12-20 20:49:02 [DEB] DAST API: System.FormatException: Input string was not in a correct format.
   at System.Number.ThrowOverflowOrFormatException(ParsingStatus status, TypeCode type)
   at Peach.Web.Core.Services.Report.ReportV15.AddRecordedMessages(FaultDetailBase fault, String endPoint, FaultData faultData, Vulnerabilities vuln) in /builds/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/api-fuzzing-src/web/PeachWeb/Core/Services/Report/ReportV15.cs:line 404 
```

This issue was reported by a customer in [Zendesk internal link](https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/356451) - please see ticket for details of failed jobs. 

Following changes to the application being tested to limit the size of the response returned to the API request the scan succeeded.

The scan job was run from GitLab.com to a private version 15.4.0 runner using the `registry.gitlab.com/security-products/api-security:2` image on 2022-12-21. 

The scanner should handle large responses gracefully and produce a valid report, indicating that the test failed due to response length and which endpoint was involved.

title: Connect app for Jira integration broken for gitlab.com
description:
## Behavior

Trying to authenticate against gitlab.com in the GitLab for Jira app is currently failing.

From: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/359940#note_1219034059

> Today I tried again, but noticed that the UI changed and also the error changed. Today I'm getting this:

![image](/uploads/db20fdc8dfa4f8f4e3fc66b1c2efeeb7/image.png)

## relevant errors

* https://gitlab.com/-/jira_connect/oauth_application_id is returning a 404

This is likely related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/feature-flag-log/-/issues/16010

## Analysis

Here's my thoughts:
* there are a combination 3 states that an instance can be in based on feature flags 
   * `jira_connect_oauth` => jira app instance uses oauth to hit the gitlab apis.
   * `jira_connect_ouath_self_managed` => for a self managed instance to configure an application id for the gitlab project, and respond to a request for  (i'm not sure if it has other functions).
   * no feature flag => just use the iframe session? (legacy)
* When the feature flags `jira_connect_oauth` and `jira_connect_ouath_self_managed` are enabled, we render the MultiVersion sign in from the jira app.
  * This [renders a button](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/jira_connect/subscriptions/components/sign_in_oauth_button.vue) that will try to fetch the oauth client id from the (self hosted?) instance at `/-/jira_connect/oauth_application_id`
    * if the `gitlabBasePath` prop is provided, it will try to reach out to `/-/jira_connect/oauth_application_id` otherwise it will use props to grab the client id.
      * `gitlabBasePath` appears to [always be provided](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/jira_connect/subscriptions/pages/sign_in/sign_in_gitlab_multiversion/version_select_form.vue#L51), by being set to either `dotcom` or the `selfmanaged` url
    * that endpoint (`/-/jira_connect/oauth_application_id`) only [will get a response from instances](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/controllers/jira_connect/oauth_application_ids_controller.rb#L20) that are **not dotcom** and have an application key.

epic.title: Self-managed support for GitLab for Jira Cloud app: UX Improvements

title: Refactor maintain_elasticsearch_update method to allow for specific fields
description:
## Background

With https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/107577, we are adding a way to update elasticsearch when certain fields change for the user model. We would like to add that to [Elastic::ApplicationVersionedSearch#maintain_elasticsearch_update](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/cc9d1b2205321c9c71a968cbcf82cc01b31110a0/ee/app/models/concerns/elastic/application_versioned_search.rb#L59-67) so that other models can also use the functionality.

## Proposal

Introduce a way to update models which include `Elastic::ApplicationVersionedSearch` on defined fields, similar to what is done in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/107577.

title: Chatops not a good indicator of async index creation
description:
The docs describe that it's [possible to verify an async index exists](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/database/adding_database_indexes.html#verify-the-mr-was-deployed-and-the-index-exists-in-production) on production by using chatops:

```
Executing /chatops run auto_deploy status <merge_sha>. If the output returns db/gprd, the post-deploy migration has been executed in the production database. More details in this guide.
```

This is misleading because the index is created on the weekend and deployment of the MR is not evidence the index exists.

title: init_structure.sql out of sync with production
description:
init_structure.sql has a table definition that does not align with what is currently in db/structure.sql and the production table definition.

```sql
--- db/init_structure.sql
CREATE TABLE audit_events (
    id bigint NOT NULL,
    author_id integer NOT NULL,
    entity_id integer NOT NULL,
    entity_type character varying NOT NULL,
    details text,
    ip_address inet,
    author_name text,
    target_details text,
    entity_path text,
    created_at timestamp without time zone NOT NULL,
    target_type text,
    target_id bigint,
    CONSTRAINT check_83ff8406e2 CHECK ((char_length(author_name) <= 255)),
    CONSTRAINT check_97a8c868e7 CHECK ((char_length(target_type) <= 255))
)
PARTITION BY RANGE (created_at);
```

```sql
--- db/structure.sql
REATE TABLE audit_events (
    id bigint NOT NULL,
    author_id integer NOT NULL,
    entity_id integer NOT NULL,
    entity_type character varying NOT NULL,
    details text,
    ip_address inet,
    author_name text,
    entity_path text,
    target_details text,
    created_at timestamp without time zone NOT NULL,
    target_type text,
    target_id bigint,
    CONSTRAINT check_492aaa021d CHECK ((char_length(entity_path) <= 5500)),
    CONSTRAINT check_83ff8406e2 CHECK ((char_length(author_name) <= 255)),
    CONSTRAINT check_97a8c868e7 CHECK ((char_length(target_type) <= 255)),
    CONSTRAINT check_d493ec90b5 CHECK ((char_length(target_details) <= 5500))
)
PARTITION BY RANGE (created_at);
```

And finally, the current production table defintion:

```
                                    Partitioned table "public.audit_events"
     Column     |            Type             | Collation | Nullable |                 Default                  
----------------+-----------------------------+-----------+----------+------------------------------------------
 id             | bigint                      |           | not null | nextval('audit_events_id_seq'::regclass)
 author_id      | integer                     |           | not null | 
 entity_id      | integer                     |           | not null | 
 entity_type    | character varying(255)      |           | not null | 
 details        | text                        |           |          | 
 ip_address     | inet                        |           |          | 
 author_name    | text                        |           |          | 
 entity_path    | text                        |           |          | 
 target_details | text                        |           |          | 
 created_at     | timestamp without time zone |           | not null | 
 target_type    | text                        |           |          | 
 target_id      | bigint                      |           |          | 
Partition key: RANGE (created_at)
Indexes:
    "audit_events_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id, created_at)
    "analytics_index_audit_events_part_on_created_at_and_author_id" btree (created_at, author_id)
    "idx_audit_events_part_on_entity_id_desc_author_id_created_at" btree (entity_id, entity_type, id DESC, author_id, created_at)
Check constraints:
    "check_492aaa021d" CHECK (char_length(entity_path) <= 5500)
    "check_83ff8406e2" CHECK (char_length(author_name) <= 255)
    "check_97a8c868e7" CHECK (char_length(target_type) <= 255)
    "check_d493ec90b5" CHECK (char_length(target_details) <= 5500)
```

title: Searching for commits in the repository commits page fails when trailing spaces exist
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

When you paste a commit title, sometimes trailing spaces can be included.

The query is affected by this invisible character and will return empty.

This increases in change, because when you copy the heading on the Commit details page, it's easy to include a space. 

### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

1. Go to a commit page of a commit in default branch.
2. Copy the title of the commit.
3. Go to the repository commits page of default branch.
4. Paste the commit title into the search box.
5. See that no results are returned.
6. Delete the trailing space.
7. See the commit being shown.

### Example Project

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->
gitlab-org/gitlab, any really.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->
Search returns empty.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->
Search returns the desired commit.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

#### Copying the heading in commits page
![Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.05.00](/uploads/eb7ec062c0cc438100bbdd31454faca5/Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.05.00.png)

#### Searching for it

![Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.05.39](/uploads/08ac0f54956714ba04fcf0f200b9bb65/Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.05.39.png)

#### Expected (without trailing space)

![Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.06.05](/uploads/098ca0393cd52510e041c5094dd01b1c/Screenshot_2022-12-21_at_15.06.05.png)

### Possible fixes

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

Some options:

1. Trim the query string, to avoid trailing and leading spaces?

and/or

2. Add an easy way to copy the title of the commit in the Commits page (copy to clipboard?)
   1. Or even a button to "Is this commit on branch: [________]"

title: Make <title> more descriptive for Web IDE
description:
### Problem

Quotes from @jpbulloch5: 

> "As a DevOps Engineer, I often have multiple tabs of the web IDE open in my browser for different projects."
> It would be convenient to have the project name in the Tab title instead of them all saying "IDE \* GitLab".

### Proposal

We should either (1) follow the naming convention we use for other objects or (2) only highlight the project name to make sure it's always directly visible, no matter how large the tab is.

1. `IDE · Group name / Project name · GitLab`
2. `IDE · Project name · GitLab`

title: Group level Nuget package's metadata endpoint triggering too many SQL queries
description:
## Problem

Nuget package's metadata endpoint `GET /api/:version/groups/:id/-/packages/nuget/metadata/*package_name/index` sometimes tiggers too many SQL queries `2000+` [kibana](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/discover#/?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-7d,to:now))&_a=(columns:!(json.duration_s,json.db_duration_s,json.db_count),filters:!(('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,field:json.duration_s,index:'7092c4e2-4eb5-46f2-8305-a7da2edad090',key:json.duration_s,negate:!f,params:(gte:10,lt:!n),type:range),query:(range:(json.duration_s:(gte:10,lt:!n))))),index:'7092c4e2-4eb5-46f2-8305-a7da2edad090',interval:auto,query:(language:kuery,query:'json.meta.caller_id:%20%22GET%20%2Fapi%2F:version%2Fgroups%2F:id%2F-%2Fpackages%2Fnuget%2Fmetadata%2F*package_name%2Findex%22'),sort:!(!(json.time,desc)))) (internal) that leads to the red error budget [link](https://dashboards.gitlab.net/d/stage-groups-detail-package_registry/stage-groups-package-registry-group-error-budget-detail?orgId=1&from=now-7d&to=now) (internal)

## Solution

We need to investigate a root cause of that many SQL queries for the endpoint. \
Could very well be that we have N+1 issue somewhere.

title: [MR Widget V2] Handle handleRevertDismissVulnerability logic
description:
After dismissing a vulnerability, we should display a `Undo Dismiss` button. 

Currently, this is the behaviour: 

![dismiss_button_not_disabled](/uploads/b384b3e02482eeec91c11c2c621a39d4/dismiss_button_not_disabled.mov)

## Implementation plan

- [ ] ~frontend The MR Widget V1 already contains the logic. We have to copy it, clean it a bit if necessary, and implement it for the `mr_widget_security_reports.vue` component.

## Verification steps

- [ ] Go to https://gitlab.com/svedova/security-reports/-/merge_requests/1
- [ ] Find a dismissed finding or dismiss a finding
- [ ] Click on the name 
- [ ] Click to `Undo Dismiss`

The finding should be dismissed and the `dismissed` label should dissappear.

Known issues:

Refreshing the page will show the finding as the previous state because of caching. If you revisit the same page after 10-15 minutes you should see the updated version.

title: [MR Widget V2] Handle handleDismissVulnerability logic
description:
## Summary

The MR Widget V2 misses the logic to dismiss a finding from the modal. This issue is tracks the effort to add that logic.

![image](/uploads/8f10ccc3aa252fd2e5fdf202ac437787/image.png)

## Implementation plan

- [ ] ~frontend Mimic the logic about dismissing a vulnerability in `ee/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/security_reports/grouped_security_reports_app.vue`.

## Verification steps

1. Go to https://gitlab.com/svedova/security-reports/-/merge_requests/1
2. Click on a finding
3. Dismiss the finding 

You should see the `Dismissed` label right away. 

Known issues: 

1. `Undo Dismiss` does not appear after finding is dismissed. This will be tackled in a different issue.
2. Refreshing the page will remove the dismissed label because the API caches the response for a few minutes.

title: Update user preference to reflect Beta terminology
description: ## Problem to solve We want to remain consistent in how we describe the two versions of the Web IDE while they co-exist. In our documentation, we will refer to the "new" version as Web IDE Beta. "Legacy" may make sense as a qualifier in some contexts, but in the user settings it may come off as somewhat negative. ## Proposal Change the user preference to reflect an _opt in_ to the Web IDE Beta. **Note:** this shouldn't change the logic of our feature flag roll out, which is to make the Web IDE Beta the default for everyone. Old: * [ ] Use legacy Web IDE\ _The legacy Web IDE remains available while the new Web IDE is in Beta._ New: * [x] Use the Web IDE Beta\ _Try out the latest features in the Web IDE_

epic.title: β Remote Development • Public Beta release

title: Validations failing on long tokens for DroneCI Integrations
description:
### Summary Entering over 100 characters into the token field for the DroneCI integrations results in "Validations failed" when selecting "Test" for GitLab 15+, and will not create the integration. Working as expected on GitLab 14 with long tokens. Also seems to produce "Connection successful" despite entering an inaccessible URL in the Drone Server URL field. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a new project 2. Select Integrations under settings 3. Enter any URL in the URL field, starting with `http://` or `https://` 4. Enter a token over 100 characters 5. Select `Test settings` The same workflow with any a token less than 100 characters returns `Connection successful` ### Example Project ### What is the current *bug* behavior? In any project, on version GitLab 15+, Drone validations fail if the token is over 100 characters ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Should accept long tokens, as was working in GitLab 14 (unsure if this worked prior to 14) ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ![image](/uploads/203145fcafebed4ffa43105e8f09ec82/image.png) ``` {"error":true,"message":"Validations failed.","service_response":"","test_failed":false} ``` ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com /label ~"reproduced on GitLab.com" #### Results of GitLab environment info

title: Repository Blob viewer: Fallback to highlighting Python syntax with Rouge
description:
Python syntax is not being highlighted correctly on the Repository Blob Viewer in some cases.

The reason for this is the way we use Highlight.js ([highlighting in chunks](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/366531)) can cause Highlight.js to lose context of what it is busy highlighting.

As an interim solution, we can fallback to highlighting Python code with Rouge (highlighting on the backend). This would alleviate the pressure and allow us to get to a better solution.

title: Retry rspec in a new process should retry the file when there's an error
description:
Automatic retry of failing tests in a separate process: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/pipelines/index.html#automatic-retry-of-failing-tests-in-a-separate-process

----

In [rspec unit pg12 minimal 4/28](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-community/gitlab/-/jobs/3472019841) we noticed that if there's an error in the test:

```
An error occurred in an `after(:context)` hook.
Failure/Error: MarginaliaTestJob.clear
NameError:
  uninitialized constant MarginaliaTestJob
# ./spec/lib/marginalia_spec.rb:101:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
Finished in 4.58 seconds (files took 1 minute 1.3 seconds to load)
5 examples, 0 failures, 1 error occurred outside of examples
```

The follow up retry RSpec process did not retry it:

```
Test environment set up in 1.876373895 seconds
Finished in 4.37 seconds (files took 2 minutes 34.1 seconds to load)
0 examples, 0 failures
```

This caused the job to be green, when it should be red.

The same error was detected in [rspec fail-fast](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/jobs/3473077751) because it did not have this mechanism.

This was found in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/triage-ops/-/issues/1165#note_1209180703

title: Work Items have the wrong URL when clicking on a contribution graph day
description:
When https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/106873 gets merged, creating and closing tasks will count towards the contribution graph of a user. When clicking on a specific day of the contribution graph, if this one contains task related contributions, the event on the list will have the wrong URL for the given task

## To reproduce

- Sign-in if you haven't already, view your profile and the number of contributions today
- Create a bunch of tasks in an issue
- View your profile https://gdk.test:3443/yourusername
- The graph should have increased by the number of tasks
- Click on the day where you created the tasks
- The list that shows up will have tasks in the list. The URL for these will have an IID in the path, but does not specify the query param `iid_path=true`. If the query param is not given, the path will assume the int at the end of the path is the global ID of the work item

title: Backend work to support disable 2FA for `Enterprise` users in the group member page
description:
There are  three ~backend pieces of work needed to implement the disabling of 2FA for `Enterprise` users in the group members page in the ~frontend:


1. [The new endpoint](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/99129) `/groups/[group]/-/two_factor_auth` could be improved. If the endpoint is meant to work as a REST API (via AJAX), it shouldn't probably return a redirect (302) to the group members page (/groups/flightjs/-/group_members). It should return a [204](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/204) when it successes, or a [400](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/400) when it fails. If the endpoint is _not_ meant to work as a REST API then it is fine to redirect, but it could probably take a `POST` instead of a `DELETE` request. Without JavaScript, browsers are typically limited to do `GET` (anchor elements) and `POST` (from form) requests. I have seen delete actions camouflaged in `POST` request (see [example](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/eduardosanz/disable-2fa/app/assets/javascripts/members/components/modals/remove_member_modal.vue#L105)). In addition, I wonder if the `current_user` and `authenticity_token` couldn't be obviated and deduced form the session cookie sent in the request.
2. Could we pass the URL path to disable the 2FA to the ~frontend [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/106837#note_1207591940)?
3. Could the ~backend pass to the ~frontend the information if the current user has permission to disable the 2FA of which user? It would consist in adding a `can_disable_two_factor` property for the users to whom the current user is able to disable the 2FA, [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/106837#note_1207590846).

```
{
  "user": {
    "members": [
      {
        "id": 25,
        "created_at": "2022-05-12T15:49:48.798Z",
        "expires_at": null,
        "requested_at": null,
        "can_update": true,
        "can_remove": true,
        "can_disable_two_factor": true <- new
        [...]
```

[Here is a proof of concept.](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/106837)

@peterhegman, do you have any comment or suggestion?

 
/cc @adil.farrukh

epic.title: Allow group owners to disable 2FA for individual Enterprise users

title: GraphQL resolving recursion causes stack overflow
description:
### Problem

While resolving GraphQL types that build a nested structure, failure to detect already seen types causes excessive recursion leading to a stack overflow.

Customer reported issue: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/sec-sub-department/section-sec-request-for-help/-/issues/6

### Proposal

Modify `BuildInputForType` to track what types have been seen to avoid excessive recursion.

title: Only use locking mechanism to prevent race condition in group member removal when removed group member is an owner
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96146+ we introduced locking mechanism to prevent race conditions while removing owner of the groups.

This change however impacted users who are relying on parallel api calls to remove multiple members at a time as this causes `Gitlab::ExclusiveLeaseHelpers::FailedToObtainLockError`. 

I realised we do not need locking at all if the removed member is NOT an owner. We can easily fix this by only applying locking mechanism for owners.

### Availability and Testing
- Create a test script using the information provided in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/dev-sub-department/section-dev-request-for-help/-/issues/32 to delete multiple billable non-owner members simultaneously through the [`DELETE /groups/:id/billable_members/:user_id` API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/members.html#remove-a-billable-member-from-a-group) in order to verify the fix resolves the error
- Please also make sure to verify that the lock still works as expected when attempting to delete the last owner of a group as well when there is either one owner, or multiple owners
  - An example of some scripts and test cases used in the original MR can be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/96146#note_1077133254)
- Feel free to reach out to `@vburton` if any testing assistance is needed

description:
## :fire: Problem

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/329253, we modified the package registry so that it was able to have its own visibility.

This allowed users to have a private project and a public package registry.

That change needs to update how the `read_package` permission in each package format API. [Example](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/104589).

## :fire_engine: Solution

* Update the ~"RubyGems Repository"  (project-level endpoints) to take the package registry visibility into account.

title: Retry button if there are failed status checks - Frontend
description:
This is a followup from the discussion in this thread https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8516#note_1173353507

> I feel like we should have a way to force a re-check without having to make a change. Like a button beside the check to re-run the check. We currently use something like that for site validation for DAST profiles. As a first iteration, that would make this a lot more useable when the checks are blocking an MR.

> Yes, we will need backend work. Outside of the 3 actions mentioned [in the doc](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/merge_requests/status_checks.html), we currently have no way of triggering the webhook that informs the external service to run a check, so we need a new API endpoint for it.

> Here is the [figma link to the designs](https://www.figma.com/file/zqEjEpLS0ggRsbUdzDrWkj/Retry-button-%5BGovern%2FCompliance%23383200%5D?node-id=24%3A7586&t=fyH8him9zvfP4o7n-1)

> Regarding the `Retry` button, we'll need to work with Foundations to make sure we're using the merge report framework correctly. For example, would you expect to see `Retry` on each individual failed check (the `GitBot` example [posted above](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/8516#note_1175253079)), or should it only be on the top level (ie 2 failed status checks - Retry all failed checks)


This will require a button to call the retry API from the MR widget

Here is a screenshot with the updated copy on the tooltip: `Retry status check`

![Status_checks_tooltip](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/76e955f73b4f25bd9ba0da14e186b69c/Status_checks_tooltip.png)

### Implementation plan

~frontend :two: 

Plan to deliver via two MRs - first up:

1. Modify the status check MR widget:(`app/assets/javascripts/vue_merge_request_widget/extensions/status_checks/index.js`) such that failed checks get an additional actions property added, with an `onClick` wired up to a new `retry` method on the component.
2. `retry` will use the new endpoint developed in !106401+, passing the project id, MR id and statusCheck id. Pass this URL from backend to Vue.
2. Additionally the `loading` and `disabled` properties of the failed status check `action` will be set.
3. After triggering retry, we'll remove the status check from `failed` array and move it to `pending`.
4. Update [GitLab docs on Status Checks](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/merge_requests/status_checks.html#block-merges-of-merge-requests-unless-all-status-checks-have-passed).

Second MR:

5. Updates to the shared MR widget action buttons component: (`app/assets/javascripts/vue_merge_request_widget/components/widget/action_buttons.vue`) to allow passing through button customisations at mobile to match what can be done at larger sizes, e.g. `loading`, `disabled`, `icon`. Additionally allow setting aria-label on the GLButton.
6. Modify the action buttons at mobile such that when there is a single, icon-only action, this is rendered directly and not put into a dropdown.
7. Update [Pajamas documentation for the MR widget](https://design.gitlab.com/patterns/merge-request-reports#actions).

epic.title: Block merging if there are failed status checks

title: Add a new field to metrics definition files to indicate a metric is used for customer health scoring
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used as a great starting point for feature requests. The section "Release notes" can be used as a summary of the feature and is also required if you want to have your release post blog MR auto generated using the release post item generator:  https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#release-post-item-generator. The remaining sections are the backbone for every feature in GitLab.

The goal of this template is brevity for quick/smaller iterations. For a more thorough list of considerations for larger features or feature sets, you can leverage the detailed [feature proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/.gitlab/issue_templates/Feature%20proposal%20-%20detailed.md). -->

### Release notes

<!-- What is the problem and solution you're proposing? This content sets the overall vision for the feature and serves as the release notes that will populate in various places, including the [release post blog](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/categories/releases/) and [Gitlab project releases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/releases). " -->

### Problem to solve

<!-- What is the user problem you are trying to solve with this issue? -->

Many Service Ping metrics today are used as part of [customer health scoring](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/customer-success/customer-health-scoring/) (CHS). CHS helps account teams identify customers that may need extra help using GitLab, could possibly churn, or may be interested in expansion. CHS relies on underlying data being consistent over time so that changes can be easily identified and attributed to the customer doing something differently.

A problem today is that it is difficult to know specifically which metrics are used for CHS and which are not. This results in metrics being updated without knowing beforehand that they are being used for CHS. This then causes a large change in CHS values, even though the customer has not done anything differently.

### Proposal

<!-- Use this section to explain the feature and how it will work. It can be helpful to add technical details, design proposals, and links to related epics or issues. -->

1. Update the `performance_indicator_type` field in the [metrics definition files](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/service_ping/metrics_dictionary.html#metrics-definition-and-validation) to be able to take multiple values.
1. Introduce a new option to be added to the `performance_indicator_type` field which indicates that the value is used for customer health scoring.
    * The name of this field should not be specific to a technology (i.e. not `used_by_gainsight`) but should instead reflect that it is used for customer health scoring (some examples may be `used_for_customer_health_scoring`, `health_score_metric`, `customer_health_score_value`, `customer_health_score`, etc)
1. Update any downstream systems that depend on `performance_indicator_type` to be able to handle multiple values.
1. Update documentation to describe the field, the new options, why it exists, and the impact of it.
1. Update documentation to indicate that when this field is set to `true`, any changes or updates to the metric should trigger a ping and review by the Customer Success team.

As a follow-on to this issue being implemented, this change should be broadly communicated to the product & engineering teams, customer success teams, and any other groups consuming metrics.

Open questions:
1. Can we get a list of existing CHS metrics from Customer Success to pre-populate this field for all relevant metrics?
    * https://gitlab.com/gitlab-data/analytics/-/blob/master/transform/snowflake-dbt/data/health_score_metrics.csv
    * As part of this issue, consider updating all existing metric definition files to reflect this and use the new `performance_indicator_type` value. If that is a lot of work, create and schedule a new issue for it.

### Intended users

<!-- Who will use this feature? If known, include any of the following: types of users (e.g. Developer), personas, or specific company roles (e.g. Release Manager). It's okay to write "Unknown" and fill this field in later.

Personas are described at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/

* [Cameron (Compliance Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#cameron-compliance-manager)
* [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)
* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Presley (Product Designer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#presley-product-designer)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Priyanka (Platform Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#priyanka-platform-engineer)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)
* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager)
* [Alex (Security Operations Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#alex-security-operations-engineer)
* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)
* [Allison (Application Ops)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#allison-application-ops)

* [Dakota (Application Development Director)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product/personas/#dakota-application-development-director)
* [Dana (Data Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#dana-data-analyst)
* [Eddie (Content Editor)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#eddie-content-editor)
-->

Create tracking issue using the Snowplow event tracking template. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/.gitlab/issue_templates/Snowplow%20event%20tracking.md

-->

title: BE: Allow users to filter epic list by specific group
description:
## Summary

This is the ~backend issue for the requirements found in https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9431+.

In this issue, we need to **update filtered search query to add Group token support**.

## Additional Information

From [this comment](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9431#note_1201754556):

>it is possible to ignore descendent groups while fetching an epic for any group and GraphQL query already supports it, so `add group::ABC Company to filter to only display results for that group` is doable without any additional gitlab~2492649 effort, but adding `Group` token support in filtered search would need updating the query first.

title: Use audit event type definition YML file when present
description:
## Description

We want to start using the audit event type definition YML files so that these are the single source of truth for audit events. In the next iterations we want to start throwing an exception if an audit event is logged but it doesn't have a corresponding YML definition.

## Implementation Plan

1. Update the `audit` method of `Gitlab::Audit::Auditor` to add a warning if the name of the event being audited doesn't have an associated YML file. This can be done by creating a method like below:

```ruby
# Inside lib/gitlab/audit/type/definition.rb
def defined?(key)
  definitions[key.to_sym].present?
end

# And then use it inside lib/gitlab/audit/auditor.rb
Gitlab::Audit::Type::Definition.defined?('<event_name>') # add warning logs if false
```
2. Update the `initialize` method of `Gitlab::Audit::Auditor` to read from the YML definition (so that the YML is the single source of truth)
```ruby
# Inside lib/gitlab/audit/type/definition.rb
def stream_only?(key)
  # if saved_to_database if false then stream_only would be true
  # since both saved_to_database and stream_only cannot be false together.
  !definitions[key.to_sym].saved_to_database
end

# And then use it inside lib/gitlab/audit/auditor.rb
@stream_only = Gitlab::Audit::Type::Definition.stream_only?(name)
```
3. Check the existing YAML definitions and ensure that the `saved_to_database` and `stream` fields matches with the current logic in the codebase and update the existing YAML files in case of mismatch.

epic.title: Audit event type schema definition MVC

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `ci_refactoring_external_mapper`
description:
## Summary

This issue is to rollout the refactoring of the `Gitlab::Ci::Config::External::Mapper` class on production,
that is currently behind the `ci_refactoring_external_mapper` feature flag.

- Introduced in: !106408

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::pipeline authoring" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_pipeline-authoring`
- Best individual to reach out to: @furkanayhan 
- PM: `@dhershkovitch`

## Stakeholders

<!--
Are there any other stages or teams involved that need to be kept in the loop?

- Name of a PM
- The Support Team
- The Delivery Team
-->

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

<!-- Describe the expected outcome when rolling out this feature -->

### When is the feature viable?

<!-- What are the settings we need to configure in order to have this feature viable? -->

<!-- 
Example below:
 
1. Enable service ping collection
   `ApplicationSetting.first.update(usage_ping_enabled: true)`
-->

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

<!-- Should the feature flag be turned off? Any MRs that need to be rolled back? Communication that needs to happen? What are some things you can think of that could go wrong - data loss or broken pages? -->

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->
_Consider mentioning checks for 5xx errors or other anomalies like an increase in redirects 
(302 HTTP response status)_

### What can we check for monitoring production after rollouts?

_Consider adding links to check for Sentry errors, Production logs for 5xx, 302s, etc._

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [ ] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_refactoring_external_mapper true --dev --staging --staging-ref`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
      The best environment to validate the feature in is [staging-canary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/#staging-canary)
      as this is the first environment deployed to. Note you will need to make sure you are configured to use canary as outlined [here](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/environments/canary-stage/)
      when accessing the staging environment in order to make sure you are testing appropriately.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab,gitlab-org/gitlab-foss,gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com ci_refactoring_external_mapper true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org,gitlab-com ci_refactoring_external_mapper true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> ci_refactoring_external_mapper true`
- [x] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [ ] Set a milestone to the rollout issue to signal for enabling and removing the feature flag when it is stable.
- [ ] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [ ] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [ ] Leave a comment on [the feature issue][main-issue] announcing estimated time when this feature flag will be enabled on GitLab.com. 
- [ ] Ensure that any breaking changes have been announced following the [release post process](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/blog/release-posts/#deprecations-removals-and-breaking-changes) to ensure GitLab customers are aware.
- [ ] Notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be executed in the `#production` slack channel and cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [ ] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_refactoring_external_mapper <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set ci_refactoring_external_mapper <rollout-percentage> --random`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set ci_refactoring_external_mapper true`
- [ ] Leave a comment on [the feature issue][main-issue] announcing that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [ ] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [ ] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Consider cleaning up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel. Otherwise these settings may override the default enabled.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete ci_refactoring_external_mapper --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue][main-issue] to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can [create a separate issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `ci_refactoring_external_mapper`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

You can either [create a follow-up issue for Feature Flag Cleanup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/new?issuable_template=Feature%20Flag%20Cleanup) or use the checklist below in this same issue.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [ ] Create a merge request to remove `ci_refactoring_external_mapper` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [ ] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been included in the release package.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the monthly release was tagged](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run release check <merge-request-url> <milestone>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue][main-issue] to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete ci_refactoring_external_mapper --dev --staging --staging-ref --production`
- [ ] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set ci_refactoring_external_mapper false
```

<!-- A feature flag can also be used for rolling out a bug fix or a maintenance work.
In this scenario, labels must be related to it, for example; ~"type::feature", ~"type::bug" or ~"type::maintenance".
Please use /copy_metadata to copy the labels from the issue you're rolling out. -->

title: Clean up image filter and cluster filter isLoading property and error message
description:
On the vulnerability report, for the image filter and cluster filter, we should do the following:

1. The `isLoading` property looks like a boolean, but is actually a loading key used by GraphQL. We should rename this to `loading` to avoid confusion.

2. The loading error message is stored in `constants.js`, but it's only used in one place, in each respective filter. We should move it into `$options.i18n` instead.

title: Remove archived package metadata tables
description:
### Problem to solve

Table list partitioning was added to DB tables for the `PackageMetadata` models. After creating partitioned tables of the same name, the migrations swapped the partitioned tables with existing ones. The existing tables (not partitioned) were renamed by adding the `x_` prefix.
* `x_pm_packages`
* `x_pm_package_versions`
* `x_pm_package_version_licenses`

These tables will not be used and need to be dropped.

### Proposal

Create migrations to drop the `x_pm_*` tables.

### Implementation plan

- [ ] Create migrations to drop the `x_pm_*` tables.

epic.title: Replace license-finder

title: UX: Make the UI display of billable users consistent and thus less confusing
description:
<!-- This issue template can be used as a starting point for a UX Issue. This is not a feature request, rather an issue that is being created for a product designer to solve a problem.

The goal of this template is to ensure we have captured all the information available to the product designer so they can approach the problem creatively and efficiently. Please add links to SSOT if this informatin exists elsewhere. -->

This is the UX issue for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/375639

title: Create Release Icon
description:
## Problem

There is no icon that represents Release as a feature. Currently it was using either no icons or the icon meant for CI/CD. We learned in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371938 that the Rocket (which is sometimes used for Release), should only be used when referring to CI/CD: 

> [The rocket icon should only be used for CI/CD and not releases.](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/371938#note_1111060026)

This causes problems in the ui when we want to refer back to releases, such as in the project home page, where we have fallen back on the deployments icon as this is where release sits under in the side nav:

![image](/uploads/93310cfcaec1b4693d40296e8e4c1049/image.png)

## Solution

Craft a unique visual to represent Release.

title: GitHub import: filter repository list by owned/collaborated/organization relation type (API)
description:
# Description

This is the part of [Provide a better way to filter GitHub repositories by organization / collaborators / etc.](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9430).

![proposed design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/d87bce78818dff871c28d5ae4d4c3e16/Export.png)

## Proposal

Basically, all we need is to support `relation_type` parameter which should be enum: `owned`/`collaborated`/`organization`. In case of organization we should also have `organization_login` parameter to put it into GraphQL query search string.

So, this task also includes endpoint that should provide us list of organizations that our GitHub user belongs to.

epic.title: Provide a better way to filter GitHub repositories by organization / collaborators / etc.

title: OKR for GitLab: Add ability to filter project Work Items by type "Key Result"
description:
# Summary

The [`Project.workItems`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/graphql/reference/index.html#projectworkitems) query allows fetching all Work Item objects present in a project, additionally, it supports `type` variable to provide list of `IssueType` values to filter the list with a specific Work Item type. Currently, the supported types are as follows;

- `INCIDENT`
- `ISSUE`
- `OBJECTIVE`
- `REQUIREMENT`
- `TASK`
- `TEST_CASE`

# Proposal

We need to add support for `KEY_RESULT` enum for `IssueType` (potentially in [`app/graphql/types/issue_type_enum.rb`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/graphql/types/issue_type_enum.rb)) as that will allow `Project.workItems` query to filter the list with `Key Result` as criteria. We can refer to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/103355 as a reference for implementing this enum since it added `OBJECTIVE` enum similarly.

This is necessary for `Existing key result` option to work in Work Items OKR Hierarchy Widget.

![image](/uploads/de18c6973046876431bdb6ee8a60029e/image.png)

epic.title: Work Items - Children Widget

title: Expose `cron_timezone` in FreezePeriodType in GraphQL
description:
### Problem

We expose `start_time` and `end_time` in `FreezePeriodType` in GraphQL API to be used by ~frontend in #212460.

However, we do not pass on the `cron_timezone` field which is ought to be used to format the dates correctly.

This issue should resolve the discussion from !105436:

- [x] @bala.kumar started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/105436#note_1194840540):  (+3 comments)

    > Following up https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/105436#note_1194339298
    > 
    > I realised that for the ~frontend  to perform time formating as well, the configured `cron_timezone` value would be required. Perhaps it can be done in a follow up MR.
    > 
    > I'll defer this decision to @shinya.maeda 

- [x] @shinya.maeda [commented](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/105436#note_1199469910):

    > @ahmed.hemdan I think @bala.kumar is correct that the `start_time`/`end_time` should take the timezone into account. Not sure if frontend is capable to correctly render though. Let's create a follow-up issue!

### Proposal

Pass `cron_timezone` field in `FreezePeriodType` in GraphQL API.

title: Geo: Many Postgres locks on Tracking Database from VerificationTimeoutWorker
description:
## Problem

Example lock on the Geo Tracking DB found, out of very many similar locks:

`961236,"{961576,958296}","postgres","REDACTED","REDACTED","active","2022-12-05 13:19:30.031488+00","08:19:45.693908","Lock","tuple","/*application:sidekiq,correlation_id:aa617b5ce294f7f4150fd052a5d8aeac,jid:be9a41a4fb2f5208e2a89f58,endpoint_id:Geo::VerificationTimeoutWorker,db_config_name:geo*/ UPDATE ""job_artifact_registry"" SET ""verification_state"" = 3, ""verification_failure"" = 'Verification timed out after 28800', ""verification_checksum"" = NULL, ""verification_retry_count"" = 1, ""verification_retry_at"" = '2022-12-05 13:03:43.393410', ""verified_at"" = '2022-12-05 13:02:55.393473' WHERE (""job_artifact_registry"".""state"" IN (2)) AND ""job_artifact_registry"".""verification_state"" = 1 AND ""job_artifact_registry"".""verification_started_at"" < '2022-12-05 05:02:55.396449' AND ""job_artifact_registry"".""id"" >= 71522214"`

All of the locks found were for queries by [`VerificationTimeoutWorker`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/v15.0.5-ee/ee/app/workers/geo/verification_timeout_worker.rb) operating on `job_artifact_registry`.

We don't need/want more than one of these jobs to run at a time per table. This job gets enqueued every minute. I see the worker is marked `idempotent!` which is supposed to use deduplication strategy `:until_executing` by default. I think what's happening is each time a Sidekiq worker picks up one of these jobs, then another one gets enqueued, and then runs into this lock.

## Possible solution

Make `VerificationTimeoutWorker` use the job deduplication strategy `:until_executed` so no more jobs get enqueued while one is executing, like:

```ruby
    deduplicate :until_executed
    idempotent!
```

## Possible workaround

Cancel the `VerificationTimeoutWorker` locks https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1063043/how-to-release-possible-postgres-row-locks

It sounds like that should cancel the query as well, which I *assume* should raise an error in the Sidekiq job if it is still running. We want the job to stop running since more will be enqueued anyway.

title: Remove association between ChatName and Integration - Step 2: code changes
description:
This issue is part of the epic https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9418. See that epic for more details.

## About

We want to remove the association between a `ChatName` and an `Integration` in order to be able to identify users in Slack without a project or integration.

In a previous issue https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384963, made the association between `ChatName` and `Integration` optional in database modelling. 

In this next step, we will modify the code to stop associating `ChatName` and `Integration` records, and finally, we will drop the database `chat_names.integration_id` column later in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384974.

## Proposal

- Change `ChatNames::AuthorizeUserService` to not take an integration. This will mean the `#chat_name_params` in that class will have no `integration_id`. 
- Change `Gitlab::ChatNameToken#get` to not retrieve `integration_id`.

With those changes, `Profiles::ChatNamesController` should continue to work.

## AppSec audit

The merge request(s) should be approved by AppSec.

epic.title: Identify users in Slack without a project or integration

title: Remove association between ChatName and Integration - Step 1: make it optional
description:
This issue is part of the epic https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9418. See that epic for more details.

## About

We want to remove the association between a `ChatName` and an `Integration` in order to be able to identify users in Slack without a project or integration.

In this issue, we can make the association between `ChatName` and `Integration` optional in database modelling. 

The next step in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384973 will be to modify the code to stop associating `ChatName` and `Integration` records, and finally, we will drop the database `chat_names.integration_id` column later in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384974.

## Proposal

1. Remove the `integration_id` foreign key from `chat_names`. Follow our process for removing a [foreign key constraint](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/migration_style_guide.html#removing-a-foreign-key-constraint).
2. Change some of the indexes on the table:
    1. Drop the existing UNIQUE index on `(integration_id, team_id, chat_id)`
    2. Replace the UNIQUE index on `(user_id, integration_id)` index with a non-unique index just on `user_id`. Do this by adding the non-unique index, and then in a second migration drop the other one.
3. Update the validations in `ChatName`:
    1. Remove the uniqueness validation on `:user_id` that is scoped to `integration_id`.
    2. Change the uniqueness validation on `:chat_id` so that it is scoped only to `:team_id`.

epic.title: Identify users in Slack without a project or integration

title: Move FreezePeriodsFinder under `CI` module
description:
### Problem

As [discussed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/105436#note_1196074934) in !105436, the `FreezePeriodsFinder` should be moved under the `CI` module to keep consistency with the [model namespace](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/ci/freeze_period.rb).

This issue resolves the following discussion from !105436:

- [x] @shinya.maeda started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/105436#note_1196074953):  (+2 comments)

    > ```suggestion:-0+0
    >         Ci::FreezePeriodsFinder.new(environment.project, context[:current_user]).execute
    > ```
    > 
    > Non-blocker. We should create a follow-up issue for this.

### Proposal

Move `FreezePeriodsFinder` to be under `CI` module in `app/finders/ci` folder, and update calls to that class elsewhere.

title: Support entering channels in new integrations form "trigger" section, and apply to GitLab for Slack app integration
description:
## About

We have a new integration form that displays the integration form in sections. 

GitLab for Slack, Mattermost and Slack Notifications integrations allow the user to select a trigger and also enter channel names of where to post notifications to.

## Problem

The Trigger section of the form currently does not support entering channel names next to the triggers. 

We would like to use the new integrations form view for these integrations as the UI looks better.

![image__1_](/uploads/94df1f220b234c805500326d50b1df21/image__1_.png)

## Solution

The new integrations form should support users entering channels in the "trigger" section, when an integration has channel name fields, in a similar way to how the current (old) form does.

The channel name input field should be disabled unless the trigger checkbox has been checked.

We should roll this out for the GitLab for Slack app integration first. An example merge request that enabled the new integration form on the backend https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/104919, once the new integrations form can support channel names in the triggers section the change to roll it out to GitLab for Slack will resemble that merge request, so use it as a guide.

epic.title: Extend Slack app to support notifications

title: [🎨Design] Objectives & key results can be made confidential
description:
## Context

As part of https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/9254, users need to be able to make their objectives and key results confidential.

## Proposal
###### Figma file: [here](https://www.figma.com/file/3KW9FtyTTDJy9u1rr6YDN1/Objectives-%26-key-results-can-be-made-confidential?node-id=2%3A85223&t=IpMmuy6zToJcrO6G-1)
###### Making an objective confidential ([🎨 design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384870/designs/Objective_confidentiality.png))
- This should be similar to the [current task confidentiality flow](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/368035)
* If a parent objective is confidential, prevent child objectives and key results from toggling confidentiality off.
   * Currently, this means just hiding the confidentiality option
* If a parent objective is confidential, items related from it will be confidential.
###### Making an key result confidential ([🎨 design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384870/designs/Key_result_confidentiality.png))
- This should be similar to the [current task confidentiality flow](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/368035)
* If a parent objective is confidential, prevent key results from toggling confidentiality off.
    * Currently, this means just hiding the confidentiality option
###### Creating a confidential child within a parent objective ([🎨 design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384870/designs/Creating_confidential_children.png))
- Add the checkbox option under the title input of the child, similar to what appears when creating an issue or epic.
- Confidential option text could read:
   - For objectives: `This objective is confidential and should only be visible to team members with at least Reporter access`
   - For key results: `This key result is confidential and should only be visible to team members with at least Reporter access`
- If the parent if confidential, the confidential checkbox will be checked and disabled, with a tooltip that reads something like: `A non-confidential key result cannot be assigned to a confidential parent objective`

###### When adding an existing objective or key result([🎨 design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384870/designs/Adding_existing_children.png))
- If the child being added is non-confidential and the parent is confidential, show validation similar to what is currently shown for epics and issues, something like: [-/tile of child/ cannot be added: Cannot assign a confidential epic to a non-confidential issue. Make the issue confidential and try again-]

###### When creating a parent objective or key result  ([🎨 design](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/384870/designs/Creating_confidential_parents.png))
- Add the checkbox option under the title input of the new parent, similar to what appears when creating an issue or epic.
- Confidential option text could read:
   - For objectives: `This objective is confidential and should only be visible to team members with at least Reporter access`
   - For key results: `This key result is confidential and should only be visible to team members with at least Reporter access`
- If the parent if confidential, the confidential checkbox will be checked and disabled, with a tooltip that reads something like: `A non-confidential key result cannot be assigned to a confidential parent objective`

description:
