## Summary

This issue is to cleanup the `usage_data_diff_searches` feature flag, after the feature flag has been enabled by default for an appropriate amount of time in production.

This FF was introduced in %15.0

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

- Team: Code Review ~"group::code review" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_code_revew`
- Best individual to reach out to: TBD
- PM: @phikai 

## Stakeholders

<!--
Are there any other stages or teams involved that need to be kept in the loop?

- Name of a PM
- The Support Team
- The Delivery Team
-->

## Expectations

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

<!-- Any MRs that need to be rolled back? Communication that needs to happen? What are some things you can think of that could go wrong - data loss or broken pages? -->

### Cleaning up the feature flag

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [ ] Create a merge request to remove `usage_data_diff_searches` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [ ] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-cleanup-mr>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] If not already done, clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete usage_data_diff_searches --dev`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete usage_data_diff_searches --staging`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete usage_data_diff_searches`
- [ ] Close this rollout issue.

title: Update translations levels (January 2023)
description:
## Introduction

With the implementation of the feature to show the [translation coverage](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/328430) in the language selection dropdown, the translation levels need to be updated on a monthly cadence.

## Proposal

Once the monthly merge of the new translations is complete, update the translation levels [data](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/i18n.rb#L43) from Crowdin.

## Documentation

* https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/i18n/merging_translations.html#manually-update-the-translation-levels

#### ToDo

* [x] After cloning: update Title, set Milestone, Due date (15th), Related to previous month's issue.
* [x] After the 1st of the month: assign to yourself, set ~2526320
* [x] Complete the [regular monthly merge](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3571) of translations from Crowdin.
* [x] Get the translation levels (% approved words) from [Crowdin](https://crowdin.com/project/gitlab-ee).
* [x] Create an MR to update the translation levels [data](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/i18n.rb#L43).
* [x] Associate that MR to this issue.
* [x] Complete the MR.
* [x] When done, clone [this template issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/349815) for the next milestone.

epic.title: Regular i18n translation merges

title: changes in audit events view UI removes all events - when using an auditor account - owing to addition of author_username= to the URI
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When viewing a group's audit events with an auditor account:

- initially records are loaded
- selecting `last 7 days` sends the URL:

  ```
  https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/audit_events?created_after=2022-11-29&created_before=2022-12-05&entity_type=Author&author_username=<USER>
  ```

  - no records display.
  - Copying this URL from developer tools and removing `&author_username=<USER>` results in events showing


- changing the data range sends:

  ```
  https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/audit_events?created_after=2022-11-24&created_before=2022-12-05&entity_type=Author&author_username=<USER>
  ```

- sorting sends:

  ```
  https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/audit_events?created_after=2022-11-24&created_before=2022-12-05&entity_type=Author&sort=created_asc&author_username=<USER>
  ```

### Steps to reproduce

- Log into GitLab.com as an auditor account.
- Browse to a project group with audit events, eg:  `https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org`
- Modify view using the last 7 days (etc) buttons, date range, sort etc.

### Example Project

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Operating the audit events view with an auditor account results in `&author_username=<USER>` being added to the URI.  This prevents the view from returning any records.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Auditor accounts can interact with the audit events view.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/ff468df922e7b266311e8fe01ac2e1a5/image.png)

### Output of checks


This bug happens on GitLab.com
### Possible fixes

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

title: Exec Dashboard - Failing request for summary endpoint
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The summary endpoint request is failing for the current month to date. 

On page load we make multiple requests to both the `time_summary` and `summary` endpoints for the previous 3 months of data, these seem to be successfully completing, but the final request for data for the month to date (start of current month until today) is failing.

The request fails with the json response message “There is too much data to calculate. Please change your selection.” 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Navigate to the executive dashboard
2. The request may or may not fail
3. Refresh the page until the request fails

### Example Project

* https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/analytics/dashboards

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The API request fails and data is not loaded

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

|Screenshot|Video|
|---|---|
|![image](/uploads/8ee459a5f3db4128e953aaca05559fd5/image.png)|![Screen_Recording_2022-12-02_at_11.53.57_am](/uploads/2b81989af55552261aff404c73951af6/Screen_Recording_2022-12-02_at_11.53.57_am.mov)|

### Solution

Force the execution of the query to be ordered in a way which is more performant. Isolate this to VSA.

1. load the group hierarchy
1. load all projects in the hierarchy
1. load issues by the previously loaded projects + apply the given filters (date range)

<!-- This bug happens on GitLab.com -->

title: Geo: Excessive jobs in geo_project_sync queue
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

A customer who was dealing with performance issues was found to have nearly 400000 jobs in the `geo:geo_project_sync` queue. This exacerbates performance problems because Sidekiq will operate at max concurrency and it will be doing unnecessary overhead. For example it may unnecessarily sync the same repo multiple times in a row in quick succession.

### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

I don't know how the customer environment got into the state other than they had already been dealing with various performance problems for a long time. You can reproduce this by stopping Sidekiq on a secondary site of a busy GitLab environment for a long time.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

We noticed this while troubleshooting failed syncs. We manually synced one repo, and then noticed that the `repository_retry_count` had increased by over 100. Therefore, over 100 sync jobs for the exact same repo were run, within a few minutes.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

Ideally, duplicate sync jobs should not be enqueued.

#### Results of GitLab environment info

This was on GitLab 15.0.5 but this probably applies to all existing GitLab versions.

### Workaround

Since Geo tracks sync state in the tracking DB, and will enqueue new sync jobs as needed, then jobs in the `geo:geo_project_sync` queue are not critical data. In the case of a very long queue, we can clear it to reduce pressure on the whole system. (In the case of a normally functioning system, clearing the queue will cause delays in syncing since the system has to realize that syncs are needed and then enqueue new sync jobs).

1. SSH into a GitLab Rails node in the secondary Geo site.
1. [Open Rails console](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/operations/rails_console.html)
1. View queues with more than 0 jobs, sorted by largest to smallest:

   ```
   stats = Sidekiq::Stats.new; pp stats.queues.select { |k,v| v > 0 }; true
   ```
1. To clear the Geo project sync queue:

   ```
   project_sync_queue = Sidekiq::Queue.new("geo:geo_project_sync")
   puts "Geo project sync queue size: #{project_sync_queue.size}"
   project_sync_queue.clear
   puts "Geo project sync queue size: #{project_sync_queue.size}"
   ```

### Possible fixes

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

Do something like https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/97438 should resolve this.
